This vote is the product of bipartisan, bicameral negotiations to fund our government through March 11. But just because legislation is bipartisan and bicameral doesn't mean that it is good for our country.

1382062149246287873.text: I've worked across the aisle with my colleague @RepBrianFitz to increase funding for research to eradicate this invasive and economically destructive bug. It's time to squash the spotted lanternfly once and for all.

1372928057762312197.text: As many of you know, education and early childhood literacy in particular are priorities of mine, and I'm not the only one. Very proud to be leading this bipartisan charge with @RepWesterman to put our students first. https://t.co/OgvlLlfUyb

1372698268325535744.text: We just passed the bipartisan Farm Workforce Modernization Act, including my provision for year round producers (like our many 🍄 mushroom farmers). This bill provides fairness to our farmworkers and addresses labor shortages. I’m proud to help modernize our agriculture industry.

1372664889483927558.text: Our READ Act makes clear that we’re fighting to make sure every child learns how to read, and consequently, can find success in their education and livelihoods. 8/8

1372664888611459080.text: We need aggressive action to combat the literacy crisis in our country, and as someone with a background in early childhood literacy, I’m proud to lead the charge. /7

1372664887634239488.text: And the implications stretch beyond education. Over $200 million in health care costs is linked to illiteracy each year: when individuals can’t understand their prescription bottle, how can we expect them to stay healthy? /6

1372664886774398976.text: Prior to serving in Congress, I was a chemistry teacher in north Philadelphia to 11th grade students. Chemistry is already a complicated subject, but it’s made all the more difficult if you are reading at a 3rd or 4th grade level, as many of my students were. /5

1372664885868384256.text: As we work to get kids safely back in school, one of our first priorities needs to be addressing any loss of learning, particularly around literacy. What people must remember is that without literacy, learning other subjects becomes nearly impossible. /4

1372664884786237441.text: For years, the data has been clear: "A student who can’t read on grade level by 3rd grade is four times less likely to graduate by age 19 than a child who does read proficiently by that time." /3 https://t.co/5Juotk9Bel

1372664883620220933.text:
The need for this legislation during this COVID crisis cannot be overstated. We are seeing early childhood literacy rates drop in PA and across the country. /2

https://t.co/2V5IBmq5pB

1372664882638766081.text:
🚨🚨🚨BILL DROP ALERT🚨🚨🚨

1299426033129619456.text: King charged the crowd on the Mall with this message in 1963: “This is no time to engage in the luxury of cooling off or to take the tranquilizing drug of gradualism.” It was urgent then, and it’s urgent now.

1299426031347150858.text: It is urgent because COVID-19 disproportionately affects Black and Latinx communities; because the police violence against Black communities, which King described 57 years ago, persists; and because Black women in Pennsylvania earn 66 cents on the dollar compared to white men.

1288645813250469888.text: CEPI is at the forefront of the search for not only a vaccine but also signs of the inevitable next pandemic. They are focused on the science, w/ experts from across the globe on the cutting edge of pandemic response research to better prepare us for future viral outbreaks. /7

1288645812449415168.text: By joining CEPI, the United States would be taking a proactive step towards fortifying itself against viruses like COVID-19. /6

1288645811606257664.text: Unless we take decisive action to change our present and future course of action, we will again be faced with unnecessarily high death tolls and community spread when the next pandemic strikes. /5

1288645810662539264.text: This particular legislation, which I also helped pass through the HEROES Act in May, has ramifications beyond those of COVID-19. What has been painstakingly clear is that we, as a nation, were woefully unprepared for a pandemic of this proportion. /4

1288645809823678464.text: Thus far, the Administration has failed to meet this moment – 5 months in and 150,000 American lives lost, and we are still without a national testing strategy or a global plan for large-scale vaccine production and equitable access around the world. /3

1288645808993251329.text: As we continue to face this global pandemic, it's critical that the United States actively engage w/ the international community, including the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI), to rapidly and safely develop, manufacture, & distribute a COVID-19 vaccine. /2

1270764774268252161.text: This legislation marks an important and historic step towards addressing racism in our criminal justice system. We are all called in this moment to do the right thing, and I hope my colleagues on both sides of the aisle will answer that call. 9/9

1270764773618192386.text: Likewise, we need to be working on inequity in our school system, health care system, voting system, and more. /8

1270764772817088514.text: We must legislatively address mental health support for police officers, who are asked to respond not only to public safety incidents but also to social service issues: mental health crises, substance abuse, homelessness and more, for which they are not trained or equipped. /7

1270764772158509058.text: This bill cannot and will not be the end of our efforts to address this issue. /6

1270764771386818564.text: Over the next few weeks, I will continue speaking with and learning from members of my community – Black leaders, law enforcement leaders, advocates, activists and experts – to hear your concerns and make sure we are addressing them in Congress. /5

1270764770690568196.text: In my heart, I know that cosponsoring the Justice in Policing Act of 2020 is the right thing to do to begin to answer this call. /4

1270764769935491076.text: What we have borne witness to over these past few weeks is a unified call to action – to address police brutality and the disparate treatment of people of color, particularly Black Americans. /3

1270764769029623808.text: It is an undeniable fact that systemic racism exists in our country and that it has since our very founding. /2

1253463342511009793.text: We are in this together, and we, the federal government, need to do everything in our power to support the country through this pandemic. 7/7

1253463341537931264.text: I am disappointed, for instance, that there was not support for struggling local governments and municipalities. We need a more holistic response, and I will be pushing my colleagues to support such a response in our next package. /6

1253463340602580992.text: We need to safely reopen our economy, and to do so, we must implement a testing strategy quickly and effectively. This legislation we passed today is by no means an end to our efforts. /5

1253463339717529600.text: I have laid out a bipartisan plan for how to implement such a national testing strategy and will continue to work with the Administration to build the workforce we need to carry out this effort. /4

1253463338836787205.text:
✅ Support for our smallest of small businesses

✅ Resources for our hospitals in Chester and Berks counties 

✅ Expanded eligibility for EIDL for our farmers and agricultural producers

✅ Requirement for a comprehensive national testing strategy. /3

1253463337985282049.text: I’m proud to have taken aggressive action to ensure that items were included in this bill that are of specific concern to my community: /2

1253463333774262272.text: THREAD: Today’s bipartisan bill will provide much needed relief to our hospitals and health care workers and will support our small businesses to help them weather this crisis. /1 https://t.co/1c8Pv3K3RV

1253446147663958021.text: I just voted for a bipartisan stimulus package that supports our hospitals, health care workers, and small businesses across our community. #CoronavirusRelief https://t.co/30hfiu2S8R

1253350784584081408.text: Today, the @HouseSmallBiz convened to continue supporting the backbone of this country's economy: our small businesses. I'm proud to have secured funding in today's bill for our smallest businesses that desperately need more help to weather this crisis. https://t.co/9gel4SDm3q

1253066830421295104.text: We need to do everything in our power to support their efforts. I urge the Administration to move expediently in creating this vital National Public Health Corps. 4/4

1253066829506977794.text: As an AmeriCorps member and veteran, I know what it takes to serve this country, and I know how hard those on the front lines are working to mitigate the spread of this pandemic. /3

1253066828546482177.text: In order to execute said strategy, we need a team of dedicated civil servants - a National Public Health Corps - who can carry out testing, contact tracing, and more. /2

1253066826948452359.text: I am leading a bipartisan coalition in calling for the creation of a National Public Health to help aid our frontline health care workers on the ground across the country. 1129112083373678594.text: On my new caucus: #SWWV was launched yesterday, and we are 51 members strong. We are focused on women in service and women veterans. Nearly 20% of our military service is women, and that number will increase.

1129112082513911815.text: If the safety of Americans serving abroad is ever at risk, we must act swiftly and effectively. We need to be the adult in the room and make sure we're not provoking or escalating tensions in an already dangerous situation.

1129112081788280832.text: On Iran: Tomorrow, I will be in a classified briefing tomorrow to learn more about what we're seeing on the ground in Iran. Congress is a co-equal branch of government, and we need to be involved in the discussion.
